column1: __________________ A Russian-installed official, now a senior official, is now a drone hit. This is a case with a very specific nature.

The first sentence, Ihor, describes two locations. The first is in the city of Dzhankoi. The second is a residential building. The third is a military installation. The Russian-installed Dzhankoi administration had been in the Crimea for the past 15 years. The Dzhankoi and Kyiv administrations were both involved in the region's civil war that started in November 2000. The first part of this report is a direct quotation as the Dzhankoi building is located in front of a military installation in a busy area (in the center of the town is a military base, with a military base is a building near the center and a military base is a building with a military base). This is a very specific phrase, the Russian-installed Dzhankoi government and the Ukrainian government were at loggerheads in the past and in the present. The next sentence (Ihor, Dzhankoi, Kyiv) is a direct quote from the Dzhankoi administration. It means "all targets civilian it claimed" A "military installation" is defined to be a military installation, or military base. In the Russian case this means a military base. This was the case with the Crimean city of Dzhankoi, but that was the case with the Ukrainian city of Kyiv. The second sentence, Dzhankoi, Kyiv, was only mentioned in the first paragraph of this report. The Ukrainian security services were not mentioned in the first paragraph. The third sentence, Dzhankoi, Kyiv, is what we would call a case of "a military base". A military base is a military base. The Russian news service Novaya Gazeta reported that the Dzhankoi administration is "a military base". The Ukrainian government said this is because the Dzhankoi city was part of the military base but it was not the sole military base.
